intro: Osteospermum apterum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white to pink petals. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its hardiness and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Osteospermum apterum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
